events.event_description: Biomass-based diesel and ethanol compliance credit prices (RINs) have fallen 45% since the start of 2024, reaching their lowest levels since 2020.
events.citation: As of February 26, D4 RINs traded at $0.41, and D6 RINs traded at $0.40; both credits are more than a dollar below their year-ago prices and their lowest since 2020.

events.event_description: EPA set new biofuel blending targets for 2023-2025, establishing RVOs for non-cellulosic biofuels at 20.35 billion RINs in 2023, 20.45 billion in 2024, and 20.95 billion in 2025.
events.citation: Since the EPA set the 2023–25 biofuel blending targets on June 21, 2023, the supply of non-cellulosic RINs has generally been on track to meet or exceed its targets. The EPA set the RVOs for non-cellulosic biofuels at 20.35 billion RINs in 2023, 20.45 billion RINs in 2024, and 20.95 billion RINs in 2025.

events.event_description: Marathon's plant in Martinez, California expanded its renewable diesel production capacity.
events.citation: Two major renewable diesel projects that we expect to boost production in 2024 are Marathon's plant in Martinez, California, which expanded its production capacity in late 2023

events.event_description: Phillips 66's plant in Rodeo, California is expected to complete its full conversion to renewable diesel production.
events.citation: Phillips 66's plant in Rodeo, California, which we expect to complete its full conversion to renewable diesel in the spring.

events.event_description: The BOHO (Bean Oil-Heating Oil) spread contracted to its narrowest difference in about four years due to lower soybean oil prices and higher heating oil prices.
events.citation: In February 2024, the BOHO spread contracted to its narrowest difference in about four years because of both lower soybean oil prices and relatively high heating oil prices.

events.event_description: U.S. renewable diesel production tripled from 2021 to 2023 due to new production facilities.
events.citation: These new production facilities have helped renewable diesel production triple from 2021 to 2023.
